passages.text: USA | Medical Supplies & Devices
2Q Sales Beat; (+)12 F installs; HIFU Vols +5%;Raised HIFU Guide; $100 PT

2Q sales increased 9% and beat cons driven by a healthy 12 Focal One placements (<cons). US HIFU procedure growth of ~5% remained subdued on payer pushback but EDAP noted some improvement here. No chg to capEx environment. EDAP disclosed a EUR 36MM credit facility LOI, which we think reduces equity raise risk. EDAP raised its FY25 HIFU sales growth guide to +26-34% on higher system sales. We raise estimates on the 2Q beat and raise PT to $1.80. Reit. Hold.

**2Q sales of ~$18MM (EUR 16MM), -9% y/y, were above cons $16MM. HIFU sales of EUR 8.5MM** grew 77% y/y on higher Focal One units sold y/y, +24% disposables growth, and HIFU procedure growth grew 5% (vs 4% prior qtr). Sales in non-core Litho/Distribution of EUR 7.6MM declined 31% y/y, an expected decline as EDAP strategically de-emphasizes the biz. Operating loss was EUR 5.8MM vs 6MM loss in 1Q25. **EDAP expects a 15% tariff impact on all goods transferred from France to the US. We estimate this could equate to $350-450k/qtr in 2H.**

2Q cash burn of USD ~$6.4MM was effectively unchanged vs $6.7MM in 1Q25, EDAP had ~$19MM cash at 6/30. **EDAP expects cont'd HIFU investment and disclosed a letter of intent (still finalizing terms) for EUR 36MM (USD $42MM) credit facility, which we view as favorable given it lowers the risk of a dilutive equity raise near term.** EDAP is commencing a controlled endometriosis launch in several Europe markets and expects to commence a US BPH clin trial in early 2026.

**HIFU sales of EUR 8.5MM, +77% y/y, incl 12 Focal One systems placed in 2Q, > JeffE's 5 system forecast. 2Q placements incl 9 capital sales, 3 op leases; up from 3 capital sales in 2Q24.** EDAP now has multiple accounts who have purchased a second system incl Hackensack Meridian,Baptist Health, and NY Presbyterian. Focal One i launch is ongoing w/ mgmt noting several cases have been performed on the new system.

**US HIFU procedure growth ~5% y/y, a slight acceleration vs +4% y/y in 1Q25 but down vs** **+33% y/y in 4Q24 w/ EDAP again calling out longer, more challenging payor reviews/approval** **processes, partic for Medicare Advantage pts. EDAP noted it is beginning to see some improvement** on this front as the co works with market access partners to accelerate pre-authorizations. 2Q HIFU disposables sales grew 24% y/y.

EDAP raised its FY guidance for HIFU sales growth to 26-34% vs 16-25% prior and reduced its guidance for the non-core ESWL and Distribution businesses now expecting a FY25 decline of 25-30% vs 20-25% prior. **EDAP's higher HIFU growth outlook reflects stronger systems sales,higher services revs, part offset by lower disposables growth.**
**We raise our sales forecast on the 2Q beat. We raise PT to $1.80, which is based on 0.5-1x our** sales. Our prior PT was based on ~0.5-1x sales.
Equity ResearchAugust 28,2025
TARGET | ESTIMATE CHANGERATINGHOLDPRICE$1.58*PRICE TARGET | % TO PT$1.80 ($1.75) | +14%52W HIGH-LOW$3.77 - $1.21FLOAT (%) | ADV MM (USD)0.0% | 0.12MARKET CAP$59.1MTICKEREDAP
*Prior trading day's closing price unless otherwise noted.
FY (Dec)CHANGE TO JEFeJEF vs CONS2025202620252026REV+9%+2%-7%-18%EPS+7%+10%-36%-77%
**Matthew Taylor, CFA * | Equity Analyst**
**Young Li * | Equity Analyst**
**Michael Toomey, CFA * | Equity Analyst**
**Matthew Aspro * | Equity Associate**

We expect EDAP to continue to make progress driving Focal One HIFU penetration in PCa and also to have several pipeline opportunities. That said, we think consensus estimates are too high both in HIFU and on a consolidated basis. Moreover, we think the exit of Litho system sales and some distribution geographies will likely weigh on corporate sales growth through FY26. We await regulatory clarity on EDAP's endometriosis oppy, which cold represent upside to our #s. We view the risk/reward for shares as balanced. Our PT of \(\) 1.80\(is based on \~1x our 26E sales.\)
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Our base- case PT of \(\) 1.80\(is based on \~0.5 - 1x EV/ sales on 2026E sales of\) \ \(60MM\)
We forecast a 3- year sales CAGR of - 4%, which includes HIFU prostate procedure volume growth in the US.
Our PT assumes the multiple holds steady.
Our upside scenario PT of \(\) 2.50\(is based on a\) \sim 1x \(EV/sales multiple on our 2026 upside sales estimate of\) \ \(66MM\)
We forecast a 3 year sales CAGR of \(0\%\) which includes a significant acceleration in US HIFU prostate procedures and system placements.
Our PT assumes a \(\sim 0.5x\) turn multiple expansion, driven by accelerating HIFU adoption and system placements.
Our downside scenario PT of \(\) 1.50\(is based on a\) \sim 0.5x \(EV/sales multiple on our 2026 sales estimate of\) \ \(54MM\)
We forecast a 3 year sales CAGR of - 7%, which includes a modest pace of HIFU prostate procedure adoption and a slowdown in US system placements.
Our PT assumes the multiple contracts by 0- 0.5x turns.

Top Material Issues: 1) Supply Chain Mgmt - Uncertain global climate change could result in more intense and more frequent natural disasters, including but not limited to hurricanes, wildfires, and flooding. Such extreme disasters could pose risks to the company's facilities and disrupt their supply chain, causing them to incur additional operational costs. Most of EDAP's manufacturing takes place in a single facility near Lyon, France. 2) Mgmt of the Legal & Regulatory Environment - Climate change could result in new regulatory or legal obligations. Such new obligations could increase compliance costs to meet the regulatory or legal requirements and may adversely affect sourcing, manufacturing operations, and the distribution of products.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) Do you have a contingency or redundancy plans in place in case of supply chain disruptions? 2) What preparations have you made to efficiently respond to potential changes in the regulatory environment to minimize financial impacts? 3) Do you plan to establish ESG goals? If not, why not?
Link to ESG MedTech Framework
Focal One HIFU adoption: HIFU treatment penetration for PCa tissue ablation remains low in the US. Continued adoption could be a share catalyst.
Quarterly results (ongoing): Quarterly updates on HIFU sales growth and Focal One system placements could be a share catalyst.
Color on US regulatory pathway for deep infiltrating endometriosis (mid- 25 to 2H25)
**FY25 Guidance: Raised HIFU Sales Growth Guidance 26-34% on Stronger System Placements; Non-**Core Biz to Decline 25-30%

EDAP raised its FY25 guidance for HIFU growth to 26-34% vs 16-25% prior and reduced its guidance for the non-core ESWL and Distribution businesses now expecting a FY25 decline of 25-30%vs 20-25% prior. **EDAP's higher HIFU growth outlook reflects stronger systems sales, higher services** **revs, part offset by lower disposables growth.**
Exhibit 1 - EDAP FY25 Guidance
Source: Company reports and conference call commentary, Jefferies Research
Exhibit 2-EDAP Income Statement
Source: Company reports and filings; Jefferies
Exhibit 3 -EDAP Revenue Build
Source: Company reports and filings; Jefferies

EDAP TMSEDAP TMS develops, commercializes, and distributes minimally invasive devices that use ultrasound technology for the diagnosis and treatment of various pathologies, including prostate cancer and urinary stones.

Our PT of \(\) 1.80\(is based on\) \sim 0.5 - 1x \(EV/sales on 2026E sales. Upside risks to our PT include better than expected Focal One system placements and HIFU procedure uptake, earlier than expected regulatory clearance and commercialization of HIFU in deep infiltrating endometriosis and BPH. Downside risks to our price target include adverse impacts from the recently implemented 20% tariff on the EU, adverse reimbursement decisions, regulatory delays, competition, and macro headwinds.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/C, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
- EADP TMS (EDAP: \(1.58, HOLD)\)

**Notes**: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company,made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
